p: Epidemiological surveillance systems, which have been well established since the 2003 SARS epidemic in China, underpinned China’s rapid identification of initial cases with a “pneumonia of unknown etiology” [6], [7]. Within only one month, the Chinese government had declared the epidemic an “extremely serious public health incident.” This familiar scenario, in which patchy shadows and ground-glass opacity on computed tomography (CT) images, even presenting with “white lung” in severe patients [8], surpassed the panic caused by the large-scale superspreading of SARS-CoV 17 years ago.
